section.text: Hey, guys. Thanks for taking our question here. Matt, I want to dig in on some of the actions to drive revenue and profit that you spoke to. Maybe just -- I know you gave us a little less there, but maybe just a little bit more on what we'll actually see what you're doing since you introduced the highlights there?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Binetti", "section_number": 1, "uuid": "227af4a4-97d5-4e6b-9cdb-406ff1420030", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: And then -- as we look at Vans, and we -- I know you said where there is a little bit of an easier compare on China and when we look at it on a one-year basis -- what -- when we look on a multiyear basis to pre-COVID, it looks like the revenues for Vans only do accelerate a little bit in the back half to get to the down mid-single from where it was in the second quarter. Is there any numerical you can give us to help us get the building blocks to what rolls off or what comes online that should help for a better trend on a multiyear basis?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Michael Binetti", "section_number": 1, "uuid": "227af4a4-97d5-4e6b-9cdb-406ff1420030", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: Yes, sure, Michael. And thanks for the questions. Nice to hear your voice. First, I would say, relative to the actions, we're not happy at all about the -- what we're seeing in terms of the profit projection and I think the approach that we took to adjusting the full-year profit outlook, while revenue remains intact. We just see some headwinds on the horizon associated with kind of rising inventory levels and a promotional environment in the marketplace that's going to be all around us. And we certainly expect that's going to have some impact on our business. And I think we felt like it was important to plan prudently in that regard.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "032bfe46-93a8-48af-ac7a-96cb3ba74913", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: But despite that, we're going to work really hard to kind of bring that profitability level back and that really is what those actions are all about. As it relates to driving traffic and conversion in our owned formats, in our own stores, in our own websites, one of the biggest opportunities we see is -- it's to really look across, and this is kind of the power of our platform in the sense, look across our businesses and where we see things working well, tactically -- within digital marketing and -- tactics to drive digital commerce. Where are things working well and how do we deploy those in other brands or other places where we're not seeing the same kind of benefit or the same kind of returns on the tactics that are being deployed today.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "032bfe46-93a8-48af-ac7a-96cb3ba74913", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: And -- just to be honest, probably no surprise, The North Face, we're seeing those things work a little better, and Vans is an area where we see opportunity. And so, we've got some of our best people across the company kind of working on that, and in fact, we've moved a couple of people permanently into the Vans business with, obviously, great track records in other parts of our company. And Steve may talk little bit more about that. But we're also using some third parties to help us really do this. So, we see opportunity to be more efficient in how we're deploying some of the tactics and some of the spend in certain parts of our business, and we're aggressively and fast after that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "032bfe46-93a8-48af-ac7a-96cb3ba74913", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: You know, we work really hard to kind of leverage the channels at our disposal, first and foremost, our own channels to sell off some of the excess inventory that we see building. We're at a pretty good place overall from an inventory standpoint relative to -- where we plan to be. We're higher in certain areas and I think I mentioned that in the comments -- on a couple of brands, in particular. But as we look across all of our brands, we're going to take opportunity to kind of peel back inventory a little bit, leveraging our own channels, and doing a [Indecipherable] to drive some additional profitability.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "032bfe46-93a8-48af-ac7a-96cb3ba74913", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: We're looking in a few places where we see the business performing quite well to maybe set floors a little bit early in spring '23 and and drive a little bit more revenue in our fiscal year, that we would give us incremental, like an additional turn, as an example. And then, lastly, as we always do, right, it's kind of a broken record in some ways, but I think even more aggressively in the short term, we're looking at all non-strategic controllable spend and are going to reduce as we move through the balance of the year with an eye toward driving higher profitability.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "032bfe46-93a8-48af-ac7a-96cb3ba74913", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, those are the actions. I mean there's a heightened sense of urgency given kind of the environment that we face. And our commitment to driving consistent and sustainable profitable growth, we take that really seriously and we're after it.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 6, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 2, "uuid": "032bfe46-93a8-48af-ac7a-96cb3ba74913", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Mike, let me build a little bit here on the traffic and conversion piece. I think an important part here, I mean, it really is leveraging the portfolio and the cross-functional teams and expertise that we have, not only brands and function, but we have assembled cross-functional teams, organized in pods, working in very agile ways against four very specific areas of focus. One is around consumer acquisition, how do we acquire that consumer, how do we move that consumer in and drive traffic to our environments. When we have that consumer, how do we retain them? Third would be how do we really enhance that consumer experience. So, we have a higher likelihood of moving them through to the fourth point, which is conversion. So, very, very specific sets of actions being worked on by these cross-functional pods. And probably, the last point here is this is something that we're taking so seriously is that Matt and I are meeting with these teams on a weekly basis to keep track of, understand, and help take any kind of roadblocks out of their ways, so that we can move very quickly and agile-ly [Phonetic] through this process.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 3, "uuid": "f2a6532e-2b93-4c61-b922-87872ce4aa0f", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Yeah, Michael, on your question about the Vans kind of -- the drivers in the back half of the year. I guess a couple of things that -- I know exactly what -- kind of like a period -- the period you're looking, I mean, the stack itself, our view of that would say, if you go back four years -- kind of, pre-COVID and look at the CAGR, it's pretty consistent in the first half to the second half at the total Vans level, globally. So, that's one thing, I think it's -- that I would say.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "9387b7b0-b1a2-4050-be80-8c256700566d", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: As we look at our assumptions in the back half of the year relative to what we saw occur in the first half of the year, it's really all driven by an accelerated impact and benefit from China. I will tell you, in fact, we are planning Vans North America to be a little tougher in the back half than actually what we saw occur in the first half. So, we're planning pretty cautiously there overall. And the -- if you think about where we are, we -- down mid-single-digits, which we delivered a down 6%, [Phonetic] I think, here in half one implies low single to low-mid down in the back half of the year, it's really all driven by that acceleration in Greater China, which is obviously coming against easier compares.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 4, "uuid": "9387b7b0-b1a2-4050-be80-8c256700566d", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Thanks, guys.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Michael Binetti", "section_number": 5, "uuid": "b9fb3a52-3171-468d-ac43-d90ab0699766", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Credit Suisse"}

section.text: Thanks, Michael.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 6, "uuid": "67377999-2e2b-4bd7-bd80-b6d4291bd162", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Hi guys. Thanks for taking my question. I had a couple of quick brand questions. Is Dickies the only kind of pandemic-winning business, or at least that's [Phonetic] fortunate, Dickies the pandemic-winning business kind of giving back some of those gains?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Omar Saad", "section_number": 8, "uuid": "916e0267-68ed-4c8b-84e2-6e7c0787f122", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Evercore Partners"}

section.text: And then, North Face, any early reads on winter demand in places where the temps have started dropping, kind of any early reads on that appetite for that category as winter starts to set in in some places? Thanks.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Omar Saad", "section_number": 8, "uuid": "916e0267-68ed-4c8b-84e2-6e7c0787f122", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Evercore Partners"}

section.text: Steve, yeah, I can take the Dickies part, since you want to take TNF, maybe?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 9, "uuid": "fd24f3a7-6d14-4366-8e5d-00f5bba8cabf", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Sure, sure.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 10, "uuid": "e850cdc3-fd88-48a7-9105-799c184b676a", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Yeah, Omar, for sure, Dickies is filling the impact here in the first half of the year -- what's going on in the US market, and obviously, particularly, with our largest retail partner. And the exposure to that value-end consumer, to your point -- we've done really well from a growth standpoint over the last couple of years with Dickies. I wouldn't call it giving it back where we think this is kind of short-term in nature as some inventories were being rightsized. And certainly, that consumer being impacted pretty significantly by the inflationary challenges on food and fuel, and those types -- energy costs, those types of things, impacting that lower value and consumer more significantly, and more quickly, quite honestly, has impacted the work component of that business in the short term.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 11, "uuid": "91998897-c313-40a7-af3e-cb22c5683736", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: But what we also know is inside that -- inside the business and inside even that retailer, our brand continues to perform on the floor better than the competitive set. So, as that -- and that business goes away pretty quickly at times when they pull back on inventory, can -- they can shut the brakes pretty quick. At the same time, that can hit the gas pretty quickly as well. And as we come out of this over time, hard to predict how that will play out. But as it does and when it does, we expect the business to kind of pick right back up and accelerate.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 11, "uuid": "91998897-c313-40a7-af3e-cb22c5683736", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Meanwhile, the Lifestyle part of the business continues to perform incredibly well and that's really how we think about the long-term growth drivers of this business is getting our fair share of the work component as we -- as you'd expect us to, but really driving outsized growth internationally and here in the US in the lifestyle product.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 11, "uuid": "91998897-c313-40a7-af3e-cb22c5683736", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So yeah, a little bit difficult in the short term, but doesn't change our confidence in where this brand is heading and really kind of the momentum that the business has.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 11, "uuid": "91998897-c313-40a7-af3e-cb22c5683736", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Yeah. Yeah, so Omar, in The North Face, we're -- we continue to be very excited and proud of what that team has done, up 21% through the first half. And affirming that outlook of 12% for the year, which is slightly ahead of that high-single, low-double that we committed to just a month ago on the Investor Day, which should be good from a confidence-building standpoint is that -- is the growth, it's broad-based. We're seeing it across all regions, we're seeing it across all channels, and we're seeing it across all product categories.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 12, "uuid": "3af2b9ef-3f6a-4c8f-bb2b-36d2071d07d2", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Certainly, the brand is benefiting from that outdoor TAM and the energy that's -- it's really come into that particular part of the market, but it's also benefiting from its number one influencing position and really driving that with strong authentic product. We talked a lot here, over the last few calls, about three -- the commitment to 365 apparel and moving beyond just outerwear, being able to focus on those everyday ready-to-wear apparel items, which giving us permission to move now more to that active component of the consumer's life that they are asking us to participate in.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 12, "uuid": "3af2b9ef-3f6a-4c8f-bb2b-36d2071d07d2", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Our footwear -- last year, we launched -- or a couple of years ago, we launched VECTIV, and to be able to now talk about getting a major award for the VECTIV Fastpack FUTURELIGHT style is an affirmation of the quality of the team, the quality of their consumer understanding, and the differentiated product that they're putting into the marketplace, specifically here, was effective.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 12, "uuid": "3af2b9ef-3f6a-4c8f-bb2b-36d2071d07d2", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Then you see outerwear continuing to work extremely well. Those kind of shoulder season, fleece, lightweight shells, lightweight insulated jackets doing really well. But now as we come into cold weather, yesterday you may have seen it, the KAWS drop highlighted some of the heritage Nuptse. Similarly in parka, I think the Mountain Jacket was in there, and the Denali. And really, I think what you see there is leveraging historical strong styles, done in a very brand-right way with a partner like KAWS, driving that that halo impact, that then cascades and across everything they're doing and that snow-ski category, the commitment to climb, hike, active, as you look at the online presentation and the remerchandising of that homepage.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 12, "uuid": "3af2b9ef-3f6a-4c8f-bb2b-36d2071d07d2", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: This is a brand that now has really anchored its product creation capabilities, strengthening its storytelling capabilities, with the addition of our new CMO, new Chief Product and Merchandising Officer, it's only going to help us to strengthen and focus on that product offer. And then with Nicole's expertise in direct-to-consumer and the online engagement, we think we've got a real winning formula here to continue to drive that long-term sustainable consistent growth.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 12, "uuid": "3af2b9ef-3f6a-4c8f-bb2b-36d2071d07d2", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Thanks for the color.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Omar Saad", "section_number": 13, "uuid": "5d6d2ce5-b220-4795-a2f8-04fe4e473396", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Evercore Partners"}

section.text: Thanks, Omar.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 14, "uuid": "a87e0312-325e-4d2e-832c-f07f493e518c", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Yeah, hi. Good afternoon. Thank you. I just wanted to ask maybe another question on Vans. I mean, I'm curious, just your latest view, when you look at the geographic divergences, and Europe looks like it's holding up so much better, curious what you current -- currently think and make of that trend?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jonathan Komp", "section_number": 16, "uuid": "6746723b-28de-42c9-ac36-4741b3640d8e", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Robert W. Baird"}

section.text: And as you think about Vans, just when would you expect to see signs of progress and what are you looking for in the Americas to know that you're on the right track here?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jonathan Komp", "section_number": 16, "uuid": "6746723b-28de-42c9-ac36-4741b3640d8e", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Robert W. Baird"}

section.text: I think the way you're looking at is absolutely correct. I mean, our European business, in general, continues to show exceptional performance and within that is certainly the Vans business. We've talked pretty openly, and I think Kevin did a good job unpacking this for everybody at the Investor Day. But -- the primary opportunity here is our North America business, and within the North America business, it's our direct-to-consumer channel. And this emphasis we're putting today around traffic and engagement, retention, all the way through to conversion, Vans is squarely in the middle of that. We have a number of test-and-learn actions that have been taking place the last couple of weeks. Taking those learnings now and we'll apply it to the balance of our portfolio. But really, looking at what will be required to utilize these -- this strong component of our go-to-market set of options -- we've got such strong conversion, how do we start pulling consumers across that lease-line in to engage with us on our footwear and apparel story. [Phonetic]
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 17, "uuid": "f8a15ab7-821c-44bd-a1c1-c4922ae8648b", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, number one is the Americas, and within that, our North America D2C. China is a significant opportunity as well. We've been certainly impacted with the COVID environment there. But again, at the Investor Day, Kevin spoke a lot about rally pushing decision-making into the regions and providing more and more latitude for local -- for local decision makings around product, around storytelling, certainly staying within the confines or the framework of the brand strategy. But really, giving more freedom and more empowerment to the brands -- to the regions. And you see that taking place in Europe and taking those learnings and applying that now more effectively with our Asia team, specifically in Greater China.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 17, "uuid": "f8a15ab7-821c-44bd-a1c1-c4922ae8648b", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Okay. That's helpful. Maybe just one follow-up, a broader question on the margin outlook. Guiding to 11% operating margin for the year now, will be the lowest you've reported in some time outside of COVID, maybe -- in the last decade or so. So just, Matt, I don't know if there's any way to think bigger-picture about what's temporary in the margin -- that's impacting it this year versus more lasting. [Phonetic]
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jonathan Komp", "section_number": 18, "uuid": "93cad8a5-7856-44f6-8570-82dba4871c43", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Robert W. Baird"}

section.text: And then, are you willing to quantify any of the actions you're taking to tighten up on the cost side? Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Jonathan Komp", "section_number": 18, "uuid": "93cad8a5-7856-44f6-8570-82dba4871c43", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Robert W. Baird"}

section.text: Yeah. Great, great question. I would tell you that we believe there is quite a bit that's impacting us this year that is, I'll say, relatively short-term in nature, impacting the margins. And that's primarily and certainly in the gross margin line. Clearly, there is a little bit of pressure on elements of our fixed-cost base, obviously, something like the Vans store base itself, and kind of what we're seeing there in the revenue and kind of the performance in the stores.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "641dc182-71d7-425f-a953-71b7f07dfb43", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: But from a margin standpoint, we still got -- we're dealing with higher levels of, I would say, inefficiencies from a supply chain standpoint -- freight, and how we're moving freight, the extra storage costs, given the higher inventory levels, is in there, that we would say is transitory. But then, really, the big one is just kind of the assumptions that we're making right now relative to what may be required in the marketplace from a promotional standpoint, both our own channels but also in support of our wholesalers.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "641dc182-71d7-425f-a953-71b7f07dfb43", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: We talked about here even in Q2, the rate impact largely being the result of higher discounts. Some additional promotions already showing up a little bit in our own channels, particularly outlets. And then, higher cost as well, and certainly, some additional inventory reserves, given our elevated inventory.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "641dc182-71d7-425f-a953-71b7f07dfb43", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, there's a lot there that I would say -- really, everything we've just done from a margin standpoint is all tied, in my view, to kind of things that are commensurate with the current market in place and environment, and are not what we'd expect to see persist moving forward. So, I think we still are really confident in our ability to drive expanding gross margins over time, our ability to drive higher prices over time to mitigate kind of inflationary product cost increases, which by the way, we continually and consistently have been able to do. So, there's a lot there that's transitory that we would expect that over time will come back to us.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "641dc182-71d7-425f-a953-71b7f07dfb43", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: As it relates to SG&A, the actions that we recently announced of over 600 roles or positions that were eliminated across our company, both -- role eliminations for open roles and also kind of reorganization. The overall impact of that, on an annualized basis, and we'll get a little bit of that this year, not -- certainly, not anywhere near all of it, but it's a bit over $100 million. And this is on top of $100 million that we've taken out, really, over the last couple of years as part of Project Enable, which was an act -- set of actions we announced back during the pandemic.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "641dc182-71d7-425f-a953-71b7f07dfb43", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, over a couple $100 million in costs that will have come out versus the pre-pandemic level that I'll call fixed kind of G&A, primarily. Although, it expands into other parts of SG&A, but largely, G&A. So, those are some of the actions and there is some -- there's obviously some benefits that will accrue to us next year as kind of we get to the full impact of those things hitting our financials.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 6, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "641dc182-71d7-425f-a953-71b7f07dfb43", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, the 11%, I agree. It's not at all where we expect to be or where we want to be, and you'll see us recover pretty quickly as we get past this kind of a -- kind of moment in time.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 7, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 19, "uuid": "641dc182-71d7-425f-a953-71b7f07dfb43", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: That's really helpful. Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Jonathan Komp", "section_number": 20, "uuid": "70bdbee8-b29f-4c38-8d8b-be3e1e88fd97", "speaker_title": "Analyst at Robert W. Baird"}

section.text: Thank you, Jon.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 21, "uuid": "023ba040-27ff-432e-a4d8-cc1f8fc8f2f5", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Good afternoon and thanks for taking my question. Steve, Matt, I would love to ask about Supreme. I didn't see how the brand performed on a revenue perspective for this quarter in the slides. Any context on how it performed? What drove that performance?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Laurent Vasilescu", "section_number": 23, "uuid": "443c416b-3876-4b4b-a1c6-6962644809d7", "speaker_title": "Analyst at BNP Paribas"}

section.text: And then, maybe a little bit more context, Matt, on the impairment charge, what drove that? And what's your confidence to get to that algo [Phonetic] that you called out a month ago, up high-single-digit, low-double-digit growth for the brand? Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Laurent Vasilescu", "section_number": 23, "uuid": "443c416b-3876-4b4b-a1c6-6962644809d7", "speaker_title": "Analyst at BNP Paribas"}

section.text: Thanks, Lu -- Laurent. [Phonetic] Thanks for the question, I'll go ahead, I'll take Supreme.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "7419fdf0-df4a-403e-b768-2220dce78ead", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: From a Q2 standpoint, Supreme was up 7%. And this is despite opening up about a week later than planned, based on a decision to make sure we hit market with an optimized assortment, remember [Phonetic] us talking quite a bit last year where we came to market with -- well under normal percentage allocations against key styles, and this year, the team took a very proactive approach to hit the market second half year running with the right assortment, at the right time. So, we were up 7%. Even despite some supply chain disruptions, the brand has done well.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "7419fdf0-df4a-403e-b768-2220dce78ead", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: We expect an acceleration as we move into the second half, because we continue to get better and better positioned from an assortment and product flow standpoint. A couple of wins here. You'll [Phonetic] be able to see these stores when we work together in Europe, but the Berlin and Milan stores are performing really well. And now, as we come out of that COVID environment, we have the luxury of consumers being able to move, tourism becoming more prevalent. Those stores which opened under the cloud of COVID, now were performing extremely well.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "7419fdf0-df4a-403e-b768-2220dce78ead", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: And from there, we've got some new stores coming. We talked in my prepared remarks around the Dover Street Market opening up in Beijing. That's the first time Supreme will be represented in a physical authentic way within the Dover Street Market environment. That's more of a shop-in-shop, but it will be a great affirmation of the ability to expand, or what we talked about, really grow wide.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "7419fdf0-df4a-403e-b768-2220dce78ead", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: We also did a refit to our Harajuku store in Tokyo. It's probably the most prominent, well-known store in the Japan market. And I have seen just really strong results in energy resulting from that. We have a new store coming in Chicago later this fall, which would be the first new store in the US market in a while. And I'm very excited to what that means is we, again, we bring the brand through the physical environment first into new parts of the market where we know consumers are, as we look to continue to provide better and better access.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "7419fdf0-df4a-403e-b768-2220dce78ead", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, that geographic expansion continues to be a very important part of the longer-term growth. And being able to get back to seeing that value come into the brand this year is a good proof point to the acquisition thesis coming in here. And it just gives us more and more confidence in the team's ability to execute.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 6, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 24, "uuid": "7419fdf0-df4a-403e-b768-2220dce78ead", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Yeah, I'll just add one comment. I get your question on impairment too, Laurent, but as Susie talked even at the Investor Day, really the long-term growth plan is -- best categorized as a grow-wide strategy. We're giving more consumers access to this brand and that really speaks to geographic expansion. It's kind of core and central to the acquisition thesis itself, leveraging VF's capabilities, VF's platforms to more easily, more frictionless, not necessarily faster, per se, but certainly, the opportunity to go at the right pace over time, but to open more doors internationally to give this brand access to more -- or to give consumers around the world access to this brand. That's the vast majority of what's driving the growth. We're not counting -- this is not about saturating the markets where we are today, right? We're very careful and cautious on kind of the scarcity model, but it's really giving more access to this brand around the world.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 25, "uuid": "7c357fa1-06ed-4d68-9244-b5ea2d44321f", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: And that's why we're excited to really start to see the expansion take shape here in the next couple of years -- in Asia, in particular, and obviously, beyond. So, I just wanted to comment to remind you that.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 25, "uuid": "7c357fa1-06ed-4d68-9244-b5ea2d44321f", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: As it relates to the impairment, I guess, first and foremost, I would say, it's all driven by what I'll call non-operating factors. So, you may remember that earlier this year, we actually made an additional payment, earn-out payment associated with the acquisition, which obviously said, [Phonetic] you performed a little bit better than the original set of assumptions and there was an earn-out. It was a bit lower than we might have originally expected given the early performance of the business because of some of the supply chain challenges that we saw last year impact the brand from a COVID standpoint, but we did actually pay a bit of an earn-out which kind of implies we're on track. And we are on track versus our internal expectations.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 25, "uuid": "7c357fa1-06ed-4d68-9244-b5ea2d44321f", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, what we're dealing with here, [Phonetic] and by the way, we wouldn't have even been testing the business from an impairment standpoint if not for what we're seeing in the marketplace relative to interest rates and what that does to the discount rates, and how you kind of present value those cash flows. And obviously, the currency environment and the US dollar translation from the Japanese yen and also from the currencies in Europe. So, for those two factors, we determined we needed to test. We tested, probably, not surprisingly, given the fact that it's a fairly recent acquisition. And how materially a couple of those things have moved in terms of interest rates and what that means to discount rates. And as you evaluate those cash flows, we're dealing with -- with the noncash impairment. But none of that's related to our operating performance or our operating results. And we still feel really good about where we are. And everything that Steve mentioned earlier, and then I -- that I kind of layered on there as well in terms of kind of where we are and the outlook. We feel good.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 25, "uuid": "7c357fa1-06ed-4d68-9244-b5ea2d44321f", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: That's very helpful, Matt. Second question is on gross margins. You lowered it by about 50 bps to 100 bps. Could you possibly give us the bridge -- how much of it is incremental FX, supply chain cost, bottlenecks, we heard from one footwear company talk about it last night, or is it driven by markdowns? Any context on that would be helpful. And then -- and how do we think about the GM for 3Q versus 4Q? Any high level color would be very helpful. Thank you.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Laurent Vasilescu", "section_number": 26, "uuid": "ae47a374-d5e5-4c49-a311-6d7feee44aa9", "speaker_title": "Analyst at BNP Paribas"}

section.text: Yeah, sure. So, I would think that in our case, Laurent, there are some -- the smaller impacts, and I'll start with the smaller impacts, and I'm not going to necessarily give it to you exactly in terms of the percentages, but let's say, in the neighborhood of probably 25% of the total is a combination of some supply chain inefficiencies, mix, and currency. The balance, [Phonetic] and so, the majority is the assumptions that we're making on what's going to be required given inventory positions and the operating environment that we expect that we're going to face as we move through fall and holiday. And whether that's discounts to wholesale partners or more aggressive actions that we'll take in our own channels, in particular, our outlets. But in some cases, we'll be ready, depending on where the market is and what the competitive set is. That's to be targeted in appropriate ways even in our full-price channels as we move through the fall holiday season. And that will certainly vary by brand, and within brands, it will vary by product category. We'll be very targeted in that. But we expect and we're positioned as we've kind of guided here to be able to take those actions, when and where necessary.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 27, "uuid": "a4a1a94c-6aff-4ae2-b9b1-23cc71f04c32", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: As it relates to kind of your question, third quarter, fourth quarter, I think -- I'd say that a good way to think about the third quarter is kind of down 50 basis points to 100 basis points. And then more flattish in the fourth quarter. And mix is actually -- it begins to be kind of a nice tailwind for us as we get into Q4, by the way.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 27, "uuid": "a4a1a94c-6aff-4ae2-b9b1-23cc71f04c32", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Very helpful. Thank you very much.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Laurent Vasilescu", "section_number": 28, "uuid": "7ff0aed8-24c3-4d8e-8b21-cf873a05c4e2", "speaker_title": "Analyst at BNP Paribas"}

section.text: Thanks, Laurent.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 29, "uuid": "093787db-ec6b-4052-a421-122179715f86", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Great, thanks. So, Steve, what gives you confidence in keeping the 5% to 6% constant currency top-line as we think about the dynamic macro backdrop?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matthew Boss", "section_number": 31, "uuid": "49694346-152b-4b40-b491-1a8f6e9a54bf", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JPMorgan"}

section.text: And then, Matt, could you elaborate on the heightened inventory and increased promotional activity in the Marketplace, maybe relative just to 30 days ago? And specifically, how do you feel about your own inventory levels by brand today?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Matthew Boss", "section_number": 31, "uuid": "49694346-152b-4b40-b491-1a8f6e9a54bf", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JPMorgan"}

section.text: So, thank you, Matt. What gives me confidence? There's quite a bit. I'll rattle off just a few points here. I think coming into where we are beginning of the second half is the consistent performance that we saw across the portfolio, ex-Vans, up 11% in the first half. And the ability for us to kind of project that to be pretty similar to the second half. Our European business performed -- continues to perform well. And that cross-sharing ability within our portfolio, the assistance that they're providing our Asia team as we stand up, in some cases, new operating disciplines in our Shanghai office, which is still fairly new, bringing those same disciplines, that same set of integrated Marketplace set of capabilities, continue to just broaden their -- really their influence.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 32, "uuid": "1fa9748f-9894-4584-bc71-d269b357abcb", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Our China recovery continues and we expect that in the second half, we'll continue to be what we've seen coming out of Q2, and certainly, coming into Q3. Our back half, is it reliant on a hockey stick from Vans? We have a much more -- a balanced view to be able to drive that 5% to 6%. We certainly sit in parts of the market where there is a lot of tailwinds. The active lifestyle, needs-based components of our portfolio playing into the outdoor and active TAMs, certainly positions us really well. And then having the number one brands in many of those spaces to engage, and ultimately, drive those high-value experiences, it gives me a lot of confidence that we've got the right -- really, the right portfolio, driving the right strategy. But most importantly, we have the right people, strong, deep bench of leaders. You saw them speak to you at the Investor Day, sitting alongside them in each of one of our businesses. If it's [Phonetic] strong capable leaders -- we're moving leaders based on the strength of our bench. Into our Vans business, we're being able to hire extremely high-caliber talent into our North Face business as well as into our Dickies business and Timberland business.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 32, "uuid": "1fa9748f-9894-4584-bc71-d269b357abcb", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, if there is the last thing here, it's the people driving the strategies and being able to really maximize the tailwinds and that momentum that we've carried out in the first half.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 32, "uuid": "1fa9748f-9894-4584-bc71-d269b357abcb", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: I'll add a couple of quick points, just kind of from the number side, it gives me confidence. One, and probably most importantly is, when you look at what have been consistently our best-performing brands over the last several quarters, it's kind of the outdoor segment, right? I mean, generally, outdoor brands have been strong. TNF's, obviously, the headliner there. But across that group of brands, they are a larger penetration to the total in the back half by a pretty meaningful amount. It's kind of a 6-point to 8-point increase in penetration to the total.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: So, the fact that our kind of best-performing businesses were a larger part of the business in the second half of the year, gives me confidence. And then, the other thing is just, clearly, the -- what we're going to see, the movement we're going to see from a contribution to total from Greater China in the back half of the year versus the really tough first half, and in particular, the tough Q1. So, a couple of data points there that I think are probably helpful as you think about that -- [Technical Issues]
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: As it relates to your question on -- what are we seeing in the environment? How is it different even in the -- the last four weeks to six weeks?
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: In our view, it's become more promotional. We're seeing it, particularly in the Americas, and particularly in China. The inventories are building. We're kind of seeing that, we're understanding that as we kind of see what the market is showing. We're clearly paying really close attention to the competitive set and the competitive environment from an inventory and promotions standpoint. And kind of the signals that we see there would tell us that we may be heading into a time where it's going to be more disruptive than we even anticipated, again, just a few weeks ago.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: And I think kind of one of the things that's happening is, we just -- we expect probably a compressed full-price selling window. Retailers are being very careful about taking in inventory and -- taking advantage of any opportunity to kind of delay receipts -- looking for a 100% feel, when they might normally take a 90% feel, as an example, to delay their receipt of something.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 5, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: And then, I think our anticipation that they may break earlier, right? And the market itself may just break earlier from a promotional standpoint as we head towards the holiday. So, that window of full-price selling, we expect, could be further compressed.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 6, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: And so, those are -- I think those are kind of a couple of key things, Matt, that we -- that we're viewing as we kind of evaluate what the market conditions are and what we think it may bear over the next few months. So -- and our own inventory, as I said, a lot of what we're seeing, and the increase, certainly, set aside the in transit kind of the accounting change there that we hopefully explained clearly, at this point. But -- set that aside, we're still up a lot, for sure, we're up nearly 60% to last year. A lot of that was planned because we were way too low last year; a lot of that is in those brands where we haven't been able to service the business as consistently as we would have liked. And then in some cases, we're still not all the way to the finish line there.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 7, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: But we plan much higher inventories to get back to normal -- more normalized service levels, and certainly, we plan for a pretty healthy growth assumption in a number of those brands. We sit higher than our plan today, for sure, primarily in a couple of brands. Fortunately, a lot of that's been core product. But we have pockets of area where we're a little bit higher than we'd like to be across the world; we're still a little bit higher in China than we'd like to be. And that's kind of a comment that might -- it's applicable across a number of the brands.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 8, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: And so, we're going to be very targeted and choiceful, but we're going to be aggressive to make sure we are taking advantage of traffic, and giving our kind of fair share of the business in an appropriate way. So, I think we feel like we have a good plan to manage our inventories back down -- pretty close to plan at year-end. We'd probably still be a little high because there are certain core products in Dickies -- Dickies products -- some of the Dickies products, in particular. Just doesn't make sense to do anything other than just kind of rightsize that over time with forward purchases. But -- so, we'll be -- we'll be having [Phonetic] a few places. But we're going to be very focused on leaving this year clean, setting us up for next year to have strong and healthy margins, but also take advantage of the opportunity to generate both top-line and bottom-line over the course of the next several months.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 9, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 33, "uuid": "4cc735bd-063a-4f4a-80ab-14af575735bd", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Great. That's helpful color. Best of luck.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matthew Boss", "section_number": 34, "uuid": "b0563c21-fae6-492c-b9a7-cee5419d3802", "speaker_title": "Analyst at JPMorgan"}

section.text: Thank you, Matt.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Matt Puckett", "section_number": 35, "uuid": "a0b9d698-9bd6-48da-aabd-d2bdfa1b2f6c", "speaker_title": "Executive Vice President & Chief Financial Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Thanks, Matt.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 36, "uuid": "c7fc9fe5-a72f-4696-94fa-df75ea75473b", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Great. Thank you, everybody, and thank you for your questions and, most importantly, for your interest. To close things out, I'd like to reinforce just a few points that I think are important for you to remember before we get the chance to engage with you again in January.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 1, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 38, "uuid": "185016ac-8088-421f-9e59-e0f93d5ea160", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: The first thing is that we are going to continue to navigate the many macro-challenges that we see today. VF and our brands are sharply focused on taking the necessary actions to drive performance and deliver against our strategy, and most importantly, our financial commitments. I think, secondly is our businesses remain to be very resilient, with our overall full-year revenue outlook holding. Importantly, we are performing well across our portfolio, certainly, without the exception of Vans, but the balance of our portfolio growing low-double-digits in the first half with a line of sight to do the same as we move into the second half. I think this is demonstrated certainly by the fact that we grew constant currency revenue. And -- mostly in our outdoor brands, but the strength that we see in our emerging brands, and I think the importance that that shows you of our model and our portfolio strategy.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 2, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 38, "uuid": "185016ac-8088-421f-9e59-e0f93d5ea160", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: I think, last, and I'd just -- hammer home that we are going to remain extremely focused on those things that we control. We know what's required to ensure we deliver consistent, sustainable, and profitable growth. And we have the right brands, the right strategies, and certainly, the right people in the place to get the job done. And most importantly, no one is more determined than this leadership team in this organization to deliver on our expectations.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 3, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 38, "uuid": "185016ac-8088-421f-9e59-e0f93d5ea160", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

section.text: Yeah, so again, thank you for joining us, thank you for your interest. And then, we look forward to updating you as we turn the corner into next year.
section.metadata_json: {"paragraph_number": 4, "speaker": "Steve Rendle", "section_number": 38, "uuid": "185016ac-8088-421f-9e59-e0f93d5ea160", "speaker_title": "Chairman, President & Chief Executive Officer at V.F."}

title: Q&A for VFC (V.F.) on 10/26/22 4:30 PM ET
